name: Accounting Club (AC)
description: The Accounting Club has been a professional student organization within the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa. Our goal as a club is to promote professional and personal development in all our members. With the help of the School of Accountancy (SOA), our club has been able to reach our goal by providing members with social and business events related to public, private, and government businesses. Over the past multiple years our club has been recognized nationally by the Institute of Management Accountants (IMA). We are also ranked as one of the largest student organizations and are open to all students with various academic backgrounds.

name: American Marketing Association (AMA)
description: The American Marketing Association at the University of Hawaii at Manoa (AMA-UHM) is a collegiate chapter of the internationally affiliated AMA organization. AMA-UHM was established in 1971 and continues to be one of the largest and most active organizations in the Shidler College of Business. We extend an open invitation to students from diverse academic backgrounds, united by a shared enthusiasm for marketing or a desire for intellectual enrichment. Through meticulously designed initiatives, we aim to facilitate extensive networking opportunities, refine skill sets, and foster a heightened sense of ethical consciousness among our esteemed membership.

name: Beta Alpha Psi (BAP)
description: ​The Travel Industry Management Student Association (TIMSA) at the University of Hawaii at Manoa is a club designed for students of ALL majors who are passionate about the hospitality and travel industries. By creating a distinct network of peers and industry leaders, TIMSA members will be encouraged and driven to pursue their goals and become successful professionals within their careers.

name: Business Executive Society of Tomorrow (BEST)
description: The Business Executive Society of Tomorrow is a general business club at the University of Hawaii at Manoa’s Shidler College of Business. Founded by students in 1998, BEST has a proud history of maintaining and perpetuating excellence in its members. Through the years, we have developed a culture of diligence and dedication to personal and professional growth. Through a combination of tours, workshops, networking events, alumni events, community services, and socials, we strive to mold our members into well-rounded individuals. We pride ourselves in producing the business leaders of tomorrow, and we provide our members with ample opportunities to continually advance toward that goal.

name: Delta Sigma Pi (DSP)
description: Delta Sigma Pi is a co-ed professional business fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities and was founded on November 7, 1907 at New York University by Harold Valentine Jacobs, Alexander Frank Makay, Alfred Moysello, and Henry Albert Tienken. With over 309,000 members and 200 collegiate chapters around the country, Delta Sigma Pi continues to develop principled business leaders for the future by providing a lifetime of opportunity for our members.
